result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric Malik Parr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary Of A Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution in the amount of $370.00 payable to Brown Deer Liquor.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank.
The Court orderd that all mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges including the DNA and victim witness surcharge and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
The Court orderd all nonmandatory court costs, fees waived due to indigency.

The court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.
Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

charges.descr: Burglary Of A  Building or Dwelling

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric Malik Parr

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 0 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR.

The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
The Court ordered that all mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA and victim/witness surcharge) and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
The Court ordered all non-mandatory court costs, fees WAIVED due to indigency. 
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
Restitution in the amount of $370.00 payable to Brown Deer Liquor.

The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel. 

FILED:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence

Defendant Eric Malik Parr in court, via zoom, with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Eric Malik Parr in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM. Case set for Scheduling Conference. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire and jury instruction received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint/Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record. 

The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    
Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   

Case proceeded to sentencing. 

e-FILED: Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights; Addendum to plea questionnaire and waiver of rights; Jury Instructions

Defendant Eric Malik Parr in court with Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont; both appear by video.  Defendant Eric Malik Parr in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court by video, defendant Eric Malik Parr not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defendant has been moved from Dodge to Ozaukee; unable to appear for todays proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Eric Malik Parr not in court, in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defendant is housed at Dodge; unavailable for todays proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Signed and filed Order to Produce
Order to Produce  received and filed

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court by video, defendant Eric Malik Parr not in court, in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Defendant is housed in Waukesha, not produced. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Brown Deer Liquor.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Eric Malik Parr in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Eric Malik Parr in custody.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Eric Malik Parr appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
